metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9208 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.4.0 to 2.4.12 and 2.6.0 to 2.6.6, the TCAP dissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/asn1/tcap/tcap.cnf by avoiding NULL pointer dereferences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.8-1
libwireshark13 - 2.6.8-1
libwiretap10 - 2.6.8-1
libwsutil11 - 2.6.8-1
tshark - 2.6.8-1
wireshark - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-common - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.8-1').
